page.title: 07Language, Songs and culture
page.content: This is a list of some scottish words used in this area now. The language is called Doric:- Auld-old, aye-always, bairn-child, bide-to stay, cauld-cold, cowp-to fall, flit-move, gae-go away, greetin-weping, hae-have, hing-hang, lee-lie, mair-more, mak-make, sark-shirt, skelp-slap, twa-two, wallop-to wipp, wee-little. Songs, a class survey reveled the following list of favourite Scottish songs, The Northern Light 8 votes, Loch Lomond 7, Bonnie Dundee 6, Auld Lang syne 2, Barnyards O'Delgaty 1. Culture we discovered that two thirds of p6/7's parents came from NE Scotland and one sixth from other parts of Scotland and one sixth from England. Slightly more farthers than mothers came from NE Scotland.
